page.title: 19The Legend of St. Martin
page.content: St. Martin the{patron saint}of our parish was born in Hungary. He later lived in Italy and joined the Roman army. It was a very cold day when Martin was riding to Amiens. As he passed through the gates he saw a beggar sitting by the road. He was very cold and wearing rags. He begged Martin for money but, as he didn't have any, he took his{cloak,}cut it in half and gave half to the beggar. Before the man could thank him, he rode off. In the middle of the night Martin was woken up by a bright light. Jesus stood by his bed and said "You cared for me and loved me. I was the beggar and you gave me your cloak." Martin could not sleep. He got up and went to the closest church, found the priest and asked to be baptised.
